result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vito A Pellerino

records.addlTxt:
1:36 PM Defendant Vito A Pellerino appeared by video.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22TR843 tracking with 22CF80:
Court notes that the JA tried to call Atty Schonscheck but there was no answer.  Defendant states that he hasn't contacted him at all.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset the hearing
Status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Schonscheck is prepared to proceed today.  Atty Schonscheck enters a Not Guilty plea.
Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
bond continued

10:33 AM Defendant Vito A Pellerino appeared by video.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck appeared by video for Vito A Pellerino.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Schonscheck states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vito A Pellerino appeared by video.  Attorney Armand Patrick Schonscheck appeared by video for Vito A Pellerino. 
2022TR000843 tracking with 22CF80:
Atty Schonscheck states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Schonscheck waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waiver of Prelim on September 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:15 PM   Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vito A Pellerino appeared by video from custody in Marquette County Jail with Atty Catherine Dorl from the PD Office. She will just represent for today's hearring only.  Atty Dorl requests a break out room. Off the record. Back on the record.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and plans to get an Attorney.
State request a $500.00 signature bond with one special condition of  No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
Atty Dorl does not object.
BY THE COURT: Court sets a $500.00 signature bond with special condition of *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
